intro: Geocallis, commonly known as the rain lily, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaryllidaceae. These plants are native to various regions of Africa, the Americas, and parts of Asia. They are characterized by their underground bulbs and their ability to bloom after rainfall, hence their common name. The flowers are typically white or pale pink and are borne on slender, erect stems. Geocallis species are often cultivated for their ornamental value and their ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
